summary: ideally, i think, deadpool characterization should make you laugh, make you uncomfortable, and garner sympathy while at the same...
body:
ideally, i think, deadpool characterization should make you laugh, make you uncomfortable, and garner sympathy while at the same time make you question why the hell this man would deserve any at all

you shouldn’t see a monster, but you should see something potentially monstrous- and maybe also a open-mic comedian fresh off acid

reblog.comment:
ideally, i think, deadpool characterization should make you laugh, make you uncomfortable, and garner sympathy while at the same time make you question why the hell this man would deserve any at all

you shouldn’t see a monster, but you should see something potentially monstrous- and maybe also a open-mic comedian fresh off acid

trail.content_raw:
ideally, i think, deadpool characterization should make you laugh, make you uncomfortable, and garner sympathy while at the same time make you question why the hell this man would deserve any at all

you shouldn’t see a monster, but you should see something potentially monstrous- and maybe also a open-mic comedian fresh off acid
trail.content:
ideally, i think, deadpool characterization should make you laugh, make you uncomfortable, and garner sympathy while at the same time make you question why the hell this man would deserve any at all

you shouldn’t see a monster, but you should see something potentially monstrous- and maybe also a open-mic comedian fresh off acid

summary: while Merged Hulk in Endgame tends to play a bit like Bruce Banner with the Hulk’s body, his personality is notably different...
body:
while Merged Hulk in Endgame tends to play a bit like Bruce Banner with the Hulk’s body, his personality is notably different from regular Bruce’s; he’s calmer and more laid back, and notably, he NEVER gets really annoyed or frustrated or angry. Bruce DOES; he’s very passive about it but he’s geuinely prone to getting irritated pretty easily. consider the diner scene; the whole time, Hulk is calm and patient even as Scott is dangerously close to having a shout moment out of sheer exasperation

now, in Ragnarok, who expresses the desire to be able to control himself but feels doomed to just be controlled by his own impulses, and shows a lot of frustration over his problems wording it, and who exiled himself after watching the destruction he unleashed while under mind control?

HULK DID.

Merged Hulk isn’t just Bruce’s mind in full control, it is a true fusion; Bruce is at peace with the Hulk, and Hulk himself has the brakes he’s desperately wanted while also no longer just being a tool to Bruce.

HULK DID.

Bruce DOES; he’s very passive about it but he’s geuinely prone to getting irritated pretty easily. consider the diner scene; the whole time, Hulk is calm and patient even as Scott is dangerously close to having a shout moment out of sheer exasperation

now, in Ragnarok, who expresses the desire to be able to control himself but feels doomed to just be controlled by his own impulses, and shows a lot of frustration over his problems wording it, and who exiled himself after watching the destruction he unleashed while under mind control?

HULK DID.

Merged Hulk isn’t just Bruce’s mind in full control, it is a true fusion; Bruce is at peace with the Hulk, and Hulk himself has the brakes he’s desperately wanted while also no longer just being a tool to Bruce.

summary: Hello! If it’s not too much trouble, could you write something where Tony lives and finally tells Peter how much he cares about...
question: Hello! If it’s not too much trouble, could you write something where Tony lives and finally tells Peter how much he cares about him, and Peter gets to meet Morgan and she already knows that he’s her big brother because Tony talked about him
answer: It’s kinda too much the same as “The Invincible Iron Man” and as much as I get wanting more comfort, if it’s too repetitive of something I already wrote, it’s not much fun to write. I’m sorry. ^^°

summary: i really don’t mean to be rude i really don’t but if i keep seeing the same “lol tacos unicorns baby boi chimichanga” deadpool...
body: i really don’t mean to be rude i really don’t but if i keep seeing the same “lol tacos unicorns baby boi chimichanga” deadpool characterization over and over and over again any longer i’m going to tear out my own hair and garrote the marketing executive responsible for it in the first place

blog.name: why-i-love-comics
blog.title: A blog dedicated to all your favorite moments
blog.description: Batman, Say it fast. Really fast. As fast as you can. Over and over. So what do you hear? Badman. Bad. Man. Batman. Badman. To me... Now and forever... one and                                             the same. - Peter J. Tomasi                                                                         all spoiler posts are tagged "wednesday spoilers"                                             add me on snapchapt! taskrnaster (with an RN instead of M)

summary: Like what are the chances that Quill gets a Zune with only 70's music. The Zune came out in 2008, and Peter got in in 2014-2015,...
body:
Like what are the chances that Quill gets a Zune with only 70’s music. The Zune came out in 2008, and Peter got in in 2014-2015, so what if there were some 2000s music on it?

Shit now all I’m imagining is him either being intrigued or disgusted by modern music

reblog.comment:
Like what are the chances that Quill gets a Zune with only 70’s music. The Zune came out in 2008, and Peter got in in 2014-2015, so what if there were some 2000s music on it?

Shit now all I’m imagining is him either being intrigued or disgusted by modern music
